title: Wigle will save lives.
comment: Hey, to anyone who participates in Wardriving, please, remember - the info you gather is associated to a person. I don't know all of the rules but, I am guessing that you get more points for capturing the same signal over and over. I can see how it could be fun. My last house was open to kids looking for fun. We played hide and seek...in cars. Clues were given to the seeker by walkie talkie. It was a blast. With War driving, not all of the participants are willing. When you are done with a round, you go home...alone. I have been a "target" since 2009. When I take my dog out to go to the bathroom, the same cars that have driven by, every time I've been out, for 6 years. People park on my street waiting for me. By the time I get to a store, 30+ people are following me. My phone and laptop are hacked. I have NO privacy. It is terroristic stalking and is considered a crime by the DOJ. Friends, across the country have committed suicide to get away from it. Have fun with it, but please think of others. I can't visit my Grandkids, for fear that they will become targets. Use it in and for fun...for all involved. Thank you.

title: It's great, until it breaks
comment: Every now and them it refuses to upload my scans. The only work around I've found is to uninstall then reinstall. Kinda sucks. Usually happens when I get huge numbers as in tens of thousands, in a single day. But, after deleting wigle and all files associated with it off my phone, again, I'm just going to assume their upload server went down this time. Would be nice if they had coherent error messages instead of html code.

title: Best in its class
comment: WiGLE is great at the things it does. It's a powerful GPS network scanner with a handy voice function that will read off the SSIDs (and optional other info) as you drive along. Logged results can then be submitted online and exported into various map or spreadsheet formats. It's good the export function works well, because the data MUST be exported in order to make full use of it... I can't find a way to view a list of previously scanned networks in-app; a feature which feels like it should be essential.

title: Almost Perfect
comment: I sought a NetStumbler type of app for Android, and this was the one most mentioned. After trying this out on a couple of commutes, the UI is quite impressive, and the settings offered are quite comprehensive and effective. I particularly appreciate the map view. The only issue I have with the map view is the 'lockon' feature, but it is easily disabled. The interface is quite straightforward and will seem familiar to NetStumbler users, although not precisely the same in the right way - it is laid out very well for a touch UI. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 for lacking a few things I would've expected based on its overall capability. There is no easy way to call up previous runs, or display them in conjunction with the current runs. There is also no apparent way to extract old runs if you don't save them before you close the app. Exporting to KML is a superb feature. In all, an excellent tool for mapping and logging WAPs.
Apps that talk without asking irritate me

title: Excellent

title: Awesome
comment: I love how detailed the data displayed is, awesome project.

title: Export options need work
comment: This is a fascinating app. I've never done wardriving before, and with the N7 and this app its possible. I still need to learn my way around it but its really neat. Just needs more work. thankfully it can export into .kml format for easy viewing in Google Earth. However it only exports files on the internal storage, and you better have a file explorer app installed (I highly suggest Solid Explorer). Even then you still have to search for the files it exports as I guess the directory is hidden. Ridiculous. There *needs* to be an option to export to email and dropbox etc.   Its not terribly accurate either however that may be due to the device itself. Maybe if I had an external antenna that might help but I dunno. For one thing it puts my own wifi network 3 houses up from mine when looking in google Earth. Most hotspots seemed to be misaligned by at least 20-40ft if you match wifi names to their buisnesses (i.e. McDonalds wifi). Again my N7 sat on the top of my dash so perhaps I need a much stronger antenna for more accurate results.  Its an app that has a lot of promise but still needs work, especially the exporting.

title: Great Wardriving application
comment: I used to use netstumbler as I drove around in my truck years ago.  Didn't have a GPS, but it would make a noise when a new network was found.  Normally unencrypted back then :-). Now WiFi networks are everywhere.  And with this in my pocket it is so easy to stumble networks.

title: Helped me pick which WIFI channel to use!
comment: This is an excellent app. I live in a block of flats and share my internet connection with my sister who lives down the corridor. She never gets a good signal because of all the interference from other people's WIFI networks. I wanted a way to find out what channels other people were using and this app was perfect - turned on my GPS, walked down the corridor and back, and then exported the data as a CSV file. Chose a channel nobody else was using and it's a vast improvement! Many thanks to the devs. Would rate 5 stars but the app seems to be using battery after it's been closed, so uninstalling until fixed (SGS2).

title: Excellent wardriving app.
comment: I've tried the other wardriving apps, but I always come back to this one. Well designed, easy to use, and good range of settings to customize with.

title: Great Software
comment: Great product. Lots of fun to use. I turn it on whenever I'm moving from one location to another.
If you're wardriving, this is what you need.
I can't import KML file in google maps, so I still can't see what I've found after I close wigle wifi & wigle won't open its own KML file
Needs to save data to sdcard.

I would offer 5 stars but kml doesn't work with web based map editor on Google also needs to use Google maps instead of Bing or delorme or whatever engine this app uses	Upgrade the map engine to Google maps and use a better more current kml format for 5 stars
Ok I like the app however it doesn't stop running on my evo. It is also a huge battery hog when it runs. Like it but had to get rid bof it. Fix bugs

title: Should be able to view database
comment: Works good, but I want to see my entire database and make sure that as I get a stronger signal for an ap it updates so I have the most accurate data.

title: War driving in your pocket
comment: Gone are the days of kismet and netstumbler and replaced by a tool that does it all from your smrt phone.
Best net stumbling app I've used so far.
Great. I would give 5 stars if I could view the FULL Wigle DB map in the app (SUGGESTION - b able 2 Download Full DB for an area 2 view on map in app)
Not as useful as similar apps.
Thanks for fixing BT GPS!
Lot of fun! Nice features.

Easy to use and i never knew that there were so many wifi routers close by.

title: Quite pleased!
comment: Nice app. Thanks! Gives me a clean list of numerous connections nearby and allows me to track down the exact location of interfering networks by db strength while walking around with the phone. Announces connections and other system stats if desired as well. Maps locations too, but limited to Google's distance so no zooming within your own building. G2X, rooted, Froyo stock.
Login fails, so only anonymous uploads work. Perfect wardriving app.
Works on X10MP
Really good at what it's designed to do, so I gave it five stars. However it is useless to me if it doesn't mark which WiFi access points are open.
Good. Cannot view my database afterwards, list is empty but DB shows x APs. No legend.

Great app. Ty
Much better than any other wardriving app I know of. Low battery consumption when not viewing the map.
Great, i use it whenever possible. Don't forget to upload. Map could be improved.
This is AWESOME! EXPORT SUPPORT! YOU GUYS ARE THE SHEET!!
Works. Not able to show open vs crypted APs, no covered area detection.

title: Best wireless geographic logging tool!
comment: Seriously. This is the BEST. Never seen anything better. Map is a bit kooky, but still is awesome.
